特記事項: 【合併】中国企業会計（国際学研究科前期）/アジア会計論特殊講義（商学研究科前期）/International Public Policy　（大学院共通科目・認定科目前期）/International Public Policy（国際学研究科前期）/国際公共政策論　（司法研究科）/International Public Policy　（経営戦略研究科）/Management of International Organizations　（大学院共通科目・認定科目前期）/Management of International Organizations（国際学研究科前期）/国際組織運営論　（司法研究科）/Management of International Organizations　（経営戦略研究科）
関連科目: Career seminar for international organizations, Internship in UN and Diplomatic Institutions
授業の概要・背景: This Course will review managerial dimensions of international organizations from various perspectives including mandate; governance mechanisms; the secretariat; strategy and programme development; budget formulation and resource mobilization; latest topics such as evaluation of organizational effectiveness, transparency and accountability. The course will be taught by senior UN and other international practitioners and experts, so that students will be able to learn the latest and practical issues surrounding management of international organizations.

第1回:
Prof. Shun-ichi Murata: Introduction and overview of the class, objectives, expectations by students.
Broad overview of international organizations including the UN system, international financial institutions, OECD, and other regional organizations.
Defining organizational mandate and roles of agencies
United Nations Charter
Pre-assignment: Read the Preamble to Chapter VII of the United Nations Charter, and search for the mandate of UN agencies
第2回:
Prof. Jun Kukita: Management of the UN General Assembly
Role and functions of the secretariat, President, member countries
Pre-assignment: Read relevant chapters of the United Nations Charter
第3回:
Prof. Jun Kukita: Governance mechanisms and structure of UN agencies: Executive Board. Executive Director
Aligning organizational goals with UN goals
Medium term strategic plan
Budget formulation
Kukita: Staff issues and risk management:
Human resources development
Succession plan
Risk assessment and business continuity plan
Pre-assignment: Students search for UNICEF Executive Board Document and read the latest programme of work
第4回:
Prof. Jun Kukita: Resource mobilization and fundraising,
Leveraging and advocacy, Fundraising strategies and principles
Cases: Polio eradication and Indian Ocean Tsunami emergencies
Pre-assignment: Students search for UNICEF Annual Report and identify who are the main donors to UNICEF and how UNICEF raise funds.
第5回: Prof. Yasuko Shimizu: Management issues of UNHCR including security risk management, stress management, and programme criticality assessment
Pre-assignment: Students search on management issues related to UNHCR
第6回: Prof. Shun-ichi Murata: Management of UN regional commissions
ESCAP in the context of the Asia Pacific Forum of Sustainable Development
第7回:
Prof.Takahiro Shinyo: Management of the mission to UN
Purpose, key roles and functions of the mission
Liaison with the UN
Liaison and cooperation with other missions
Reading Materials to be provided in advance of the class
第8回:
Prof. Shun-ichi Murata (guest lecturer is expected): Management of the UN Security Council
Role and functions of the secretariat, P5s, Non-Permanent members, Process management
Pre-assignment: Read relevant chapters of the United Nations Charter
第9回: Prof. Shun-ichi Murata (guest lecturer is expected): Country level programme cycle, UN Sustainable Development Cooperation Framework (UNSDCF), Agency Country programme development, operational alignment to programmes with staff and budget
Reading Materials to be provided in advance of the class
第10回:
Prof. Makiko Tagashira:
The role of the UN Economic and Social Council (ECOSOC) and its subsidiary bodies (UN Regional Commissions Functional Commissions and expert bodies, standing committees and ad hoc bodies.) Briefly touch upon ACABQ, GA 5th Committee, ICSC.

Pre-assignment:
Students online search on the United Nations ECOSOC system and GA 5th Committee (Administrative and Budgetary Committee)
第11回:
Prof. MakikoTagashira:

Inter-Agency Coordination at the Global Level:
Newly established UN Development Coordination Office (DOC) (Jan.2019) and its role: Resident Coordinator Systems. Chief Executive Board for Coordination (CEB), UN Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA), Office of the High Commissioner for Human Rights (OHCHR), UN Office for Disaster Risk Reduction (UNDRR)

Pre-assignment:
 Students online search on DOC, CEB,   OCHA, OHCHR, UNDRR
第12回:
Prof. Rintaro Mori
Topic:
Relationship and the modality of collaboration with member states in the context of country support will be discussed. Experiences of policy responses to rapid fertility decline in Bhutan and other countries at the United Nations Population Fund will be employed as case studies. Roles of expertise within and outside the United Nations system will particularly be discussed.

Brainstorming on the topic (key questions)
What is the capacity to develop population policies in low, middle, and high-income countries?
What is the best practice on who to fund population policies in the low and middle-income countries?
第13回:
Prof. Rintaro Mori: 

Discussion continues of the above
第14回:
Prof. Shun-ichi Murata
Students' presentation on specific management issues at UN
Pre-assignment: Students prepare final presentations on specific management issues at UN
